siteMetadata.title: rantum.dev
siteMetadata.subtitle: digital dwelling of andrew maury. digital developer @ecomloop in burlingame, ca. san matean nantucketer on a rantum scoot.

frontmatter.title: Expected outputs
frontmatter.description: Recognize the expected outputs from a given effort. Don't expect results that don't match the inputs.

frontmatter.title: Make things, better
frontmatter.description: When change happens quickly, it's a chance to build new things. Use this chance to make things, better this time.

frontmatter.title: Good friction
frontmatter.description: Good friction makes for more memorable and unusual experiences. Digital processes work to eliminate all friction, including the good points.

frontmatter.title: Simplify paths
frontmatter.description: Simplify paths by eliminating distractions. Get rid of the extraneous, and make the next step clear. Paths are effective because they are a clear way through an otherwise difficult crossing.

frontmatter.title: Uncover what's unseen
frontmatter.description: Seek out what's unseen. Develop ways to interpret this to a meaningful format for humans.

frontmatter.title: Balanced building
frontmatter.description: If a project is made to do something for others, make sure to get feedback along the way. It's hard to build in a silo, particularly if it's meant for others.

frontmatter.title: Defending data
frontmatter.description: Defend it because it has internal value, regardless of perceived value from others. Don't give opportunity for others to control vital parts. Make it more trouble than it's worth.

frontmatter.title: Bigger strides
frontmatter.description: Utilize the time effectively by taking swings in areas that look like potential opportunities. Make the swings worthwhile, and go after the right opportunities.
